mentions.context: IMOD [41] is an image processing, modelling and visualisation software collection for electron microscopy.
JAVA is the programming language ICY, IMAGEJ, FIJI, QUPATH and compatible plugins are written in.
FIJI [30] is an image analysis software based on IM-AGEJ and a collection of IMAGEJ-and IMAGEJ2 compatible plugins focusing on general-purpose image analysis in the life sciences.
SCILS (Bruker, Billerica, MA, USA) is a software for analysis of mass-spectrometry imaging (MSI) data, including machine learning algorithms and tools for visualising ion images and mass spectra.

TRAKEM2 [82,84] is a FIJI plugin for registration, stitching and management of large-scale electron microscopy data which offers tools for segmentation and reconstruction of objects such as neurons in 3D.

MATLAB (Mathworks, Natick, MA, USA) is a software environment for numeric computing that provides a multi-paradigm programming language and a number of dedicated applications and toolboxes, for example, for image processing, computer vision, statistics and machine learning.
IMAGEJ MACRO [37] is a limited programming language specific to the IMAGEJ platform useful for automating image processing routines.
Ilastik classifiers can be used from FIJI and CELLPROFILER.
IMGLIB2 [40] is an image processing framework and collection of algorithms.
CellPose plugins exist for CELLPROFILER, QUPATH and FIJI.
ITK SNAP [43] is a software application specifically for segmentation and surface rendering of 3D medical imaging datasets based on ITK.
EMAN2 [28] is a software application focusing on cryoEM, covering techniques such as single particle analysis, cryo-electron tomography or sub-tomogram averaging.
NANOJ [54] is a toolbox of IMAGEJ plugins for superresolution microscopy processing and analysis tasks, including drift correction and channel registration.
NUMPY [57] is a PYTHON library and a collection of efficient array processing algorithms.
JAVASCRIPT is a scripting language used for automation of image analysis routines in ICY, IMAGEJ and FIJI.
AMIRA-AVIZO (Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc., Waltham, MA, USA) is a 2D-5D image processing, visualisation and analysis software.

CCP-EM [19] the Collaborative Computational Project for electron cryo-microscopy is a community guiding the users of CRYO-EM software tools as well as developers of software packages and file formats.
GROOVY [31] is a scripting language that can be used for automating image analysis routines in QUPATH and FIJI.
IMAGEJ [35] is an image analysis software and framework for image analysis algorithms integrated in FIJI, ICY, MICROMANAGER, QUPATH and others.
QUPATH [63] is an image analysis software for quantitative pathology.
TOMOPY [79] is an open-source PYTHON package for processing tomography data and image reconstruction.
TOMVIZ [80] is a software package tailored for processing, visualisation, and analysis of 3D tomographic data acquired with transmission electron microscopy.
BLENDER [16] is a 3D surface rendering, modelling and visualisation software with PYTHON scripting, simulation and video editing capabilities.
CATMAID [18] is a web application to navigate, share and collaboratively annotate massive volume image data sets.
ELASTIX [27] is a standalone command-line tool for registration of 2D and 3D image data based on the ITK library.

ILASTIK [34] is an image analysis software offering easy-to-use machine learning capabilities for image segmentation, object classification, object tracking and statistical analysis of microscopy image data.
NIS-ELEMENTS (Nikon, Tokyo, Japan) is a software for microscope control, computer-assisted image acquisition and analysis.
CELLPOSE [21] is a deep-learning based segmentation algorithm for biological structures such as cell and cell nuclei in microscopy images.
GWYDDION [32] is a modular program for scanning probe microscopy data visualisation and analysis, primarily focused on the analysis of altitude maps such as obtained by atomic force microscopes.
PARAVIEW [59] is a software for vector and surface data analysis and visualisation based on the ITK library.
SCIPY [68,70] is a collection of algorithms for scientific data processing, simulation, optimisation and analysis.
SERIALEM [71] is an acquisition software for a variety of transmission electron microscopes.
STACKREG [75] is an IMAGEJ plugin for 2D + time image registration.
3D SLICER [11] is an image processing software based on the ITK library focused on medical imaging with 3D surface extraction, rendering and analysis capabilities.
TRACKMATE [81] is a FIJI plugin for object tracking in 2D+t and 3D+t image data.

BIOFORMATS [15] is an image file format interoperability library which serves multiple image analysis software applications such as FIJI, OMERO and QUPATH, and programming environments such as MATLAB, JAVA and PYTHON to load image data from many formats and vendors.
SR-TESSLER [74] is a standalone software for quantitative analysis of localisation-based super-resolution microscopy data.
ARIVIS VISION 4D (Arivis AG, Rostock, Germany) is an image analysis software for processing multichannel 2D, 3D and 4D data, focused but not limited to microscopy data.
BIGSTITCHER [14] is an automated and interactive image registration/fusion FIJI plugin capable of handling terabyte sized image data.
STARDIST [76,77] is a deep-learning based PYTHON library for segmenting star-shaped objects such as cell nuclei which is also available as plugins for CELLPRO- FILER, FIJI and QUPATH.

CELLPROFILER [22] is an image analysis software application with graphical user interface (GUI) for user-friendly configuration of standardised image analysis workflows focusing on high-throughput microscopy imaging data of cells with capabilities for extracting tabular image feature data in high-performance-computing environments.
MORPHOGRAPHX [52] is a software for visualisation and analysis of 4D datasets.
BIGDATAVIEWER [13] is an n-dimensional image viewer component for slicing volumes in arbitrary directions.
DECONVOLUTIONLAB2 [24] is a collection of image deconvolution algorithms accessible as standalone command-line interface and as user-friendly IMAGEJ plugin.
CELLPROFILER ANALYST [23] is a data exploration software for further visualisation and analysis of tabular data produced with CELLPROFILER.
LEICA APPLICATION SUITE X (Leica Microsystems GmbH, Wetzlar, Germany) is a software for microscope control, image acquisition, visualisation and analysis.
MICROSCOPY IMAGE BROWSER [51] is a MATLAB-based software for advanced image processing, segmentation, quantification, and visualisation of multi-dimensional light and electron microscopy datasets.

FAIRSIM [29] is an IMAGEJ plugin for reconstructing structured illumination microscopy super-resolution images from raw data.
NEURONJ [56] is an IMAGEJ plugin for neurite tracing and analysis.

JYTHON is a Java-compatible scripting language based on the syntax of PYTHON 2. It can be used for automation of image analysis routines in FJIJ but is technically not compatible with NUMPY, SCIPY, SCIKIT- IMAGE and other PYTHON-based libraries.

Processing big image data, in the form of large 3D image stacks, long 3D+time data or large collections of 2D or 3D image data sets, is also a hot topic where new tools developed using remote-data, remotecomputing and network-based approaches are emerging [103-109] and also semi-commercial solutions are appearing such as APEER (Zeiss AG).
